TopicTitle: The Practical On-Kerbin Sci-Fi Film challenge

Articles.Content:
**Your budget was cut.**

**you can forget about sending multi-billion dollar craft into space just for a movie!**

**You must get creative and figure it out on Kerbin.**

**-Producers**

**The Challenge:**

You must create a fully fledged film in KSP. Sounds easy, right? Here's the catch:

It must be a film about landing on another world and it must all be done without leaving Kerbin !!

This challenge is mainly aimed at the Filmmakers out there (myself included. I've wanted to do this for a while)

Anyways, here are the rules:

**Rules:**

- No use of the "Hack Gravity Cheat". You don't have the budget for that!
- You can't use the "infinite fuel cheat".
- You can only use the mods below. Some will put you in different categories though, so keep that in mind.
- No Rockets allowed. use planes to transport stuff.
- Editor effects are allowed (green screen, blue screen, whateverthehellyouwant screen, etc...)
- Have fun and good luck!
- you can have rockets on your sets/rigs. just make sure to limit them to 10% **MAXIMUM** or your death by angry producers is certain. Fuel is expensive!
- Ion engines are allowed to burn at 100% thrust. They can't move anything within the atmosphere... or so they claim (and they can blow up white-houses as an intergalactic greeting apparently)

**Mods allowed:**

- Hyperedit (if you want to. you'll be put into the Hyperedit category if you do and make sure to mention that when submitting your film/entry)
- PartPacks in general (no cheaty ones that alter physics 'n' stuff though)
- BDArmoury and other weapon mods
- rover parts packs in general (Kerbal Foundries included. You can't get enough of 'em tracks)
- Camera mods (Kerbcam and Camera tools , unless you want to build camera booms)
- And, of course, infernal/Damned robotics for articulation of rigs
- Texture replacer and Environmental Visual Enhancement packs.#
- KAS

**Categories:**

- Hyperedit movies: Films that used Hyperedit to transport rigs around kerbin instead of Planes and rovers.

- Conventional movies: Films that used planes and rovers to transport rigs around Kerbin

**Scoring system?**

......

how good the films are, I guess? Oh! I've got it! After your entry/In your post, mention a film you liked! How's that sound? Good? I thought so.

Best of luck to all of you! I look forward to seeing what the film community is capable of.

**Entry Requirements:**

- behind the scenes pics
- list of mods used
- the film

**Concerning the VFX rules:** 

I was asked by Highlad:

> 
> To what extent are we allowed to use our 'editors' and VFX programs? Because if its an open ended rule, I might go full VFX guru and greenscreen the absolute shi*p* out out some footage. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You're allowed to use VFX to a huge extent. YOu can go ahead and hire a crew of stuntmen for a shot of your film (not sure why you'd want to do that ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) ) **BUT!!!** You have to film all the backround shots for a greenscreen/bluescreen/whateverthehellyouwant screen on Kerbin/from high up in its atmosphere. You can't leave the atmosphere. You can only go as high as your best atmospheric plane can (without going suborbital, you sly b\*\*\*\*\*rds XD ).

For example, if you want a space scene;

A) go to the mountains

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) Look to the night sky

C)Start Filming

D) film the desired rig in front of a greenscreen

E) Place the clip of the rig in front of a green screen onto the"night Sky" clip

F) Space Clip without leaving the atmosphere!

***BEST OF LUCK!***

The White House demolition was the toughest part in it. At first I tried separatrons to overheat small fuel canisters until they exploded. It didn't work out too well. I finally decided on decouplers to drop them onto the ground where they'd explode, synchronized with hydraulic separators to split apart the panels making up the facade. I found KSP couldn't handle more than 4 separation events at a time (in series), so I had to do it in sequence.
Are there any mods or techniques people know to make them talk / move their mouths? I can't really give them peanut butter like they did with Mister Ed.

A general question about rules: Does the limit on thrust apply to ion engines too? They're practically ineffectual for thrust, but work great for various effects.

Also, what about HotRockets/CoolRockets, Engine Lighting, Scatterer, or other visual mods like that? I have an idea for a scene that involves one or more of these. (I won't say what because SPOILERS.)

More seriously: You can barely make them change expression as is. I'd love to be able to articulate them within KSP itself. But I suspect you have to do it in Blender, and I don't think anyone outside Squad has the models to do that currently.
